bio:
Nilanjan Das is Assistant Professor Faculty Fellow at NYU Shanghai.  He was a post-doctoral fellow at UNC Chapel Hill for the academic year 2016-2017. He holds a PhD from MIT and a BA and MA from Jadavpur University, Kolkata.


Professor Das’s research interests are epistemology, ethics, and classical Indian philosophy in Sanskrit. His work has appeared in the Journal of Indian Philosophy and Noûs. More details of his work can be found on his personal website.

Recent Publications

“Transparency and the KK Principle” (with Bernhard Salow), forthcoming in Noûs.
